content.text: The probability of picking a green pen from a box is 0.17 .
Find the probability of not picking a green pen from the box.
\(A B C D\) is a quadrilateral. \(C D E\) is a straight line. \(A F B\) is an isosceles triangle.
Find the value of \(x\) and the value of \(y\).
Write down the number of planes of symmetry of this pyramid.
Using two of the letters from \(A, B, C, D, E\) and \(M\), complete the statement about the pyramid.
The axis of rotational symmetry passes through the points .............. and ..............
The diagram shows a pyramid \(A B C D E\) with a square base.
\(M\) is the centre of the square base.
Describe fully the single transformation that maps triangle \(A\) onto triangle \(B\).
triangle \(A\) after a reflection in the line \(x = -1\)
triangle \(A\) after a rotation \(90^{\circ}\) clockwise, centre \((1, - 2)\) .
On the grid, draw the image of
The number of ice creams sold increases as the temperature rises.
What type of correlation does this statement describe?
There are 15 giraffes in a group.
The table gives information about the heights of the 15 giraffes.

table.html:
One giraffe has a height of 2.6 m
No giraffe is shorter than 2.5 m
The range of heights for the 15 giraffes is 2.3 m
More than 3 giraffes have the same height
The modal height for the giraffes is 3.9 m

content.text: The stem-and-leaf diagram shows information about the height of 9 of these giraffes.
Key: \(4|1\) represents a giraffe height of 4.1 m
Use the information in the table to complete the stem-and-leaf diagram for the group of 15 giraffes.
Give your answer as a fraction in its simplest form.
Give your answer as a mixed number in its simplest form.
Write 42 as a product of its prime factors.
Find the highest common factor (HCF) of 84 and 70.
One solution of this equation is \(x=6\).
Complete the table to show the possible outcomes.
Angela picks a number at random from the numbers 1, 2 and 3. She then picks a number at random from the numbers 4, 5 and 6. She adds the two numbers to find the total.
\(H\) is the point \((-3,8)\) and \(K\) is the point \((-4,0)\).
Find angle \(DCB\), giving a geometrical reason.
\(A, B, C\) and \(D\) are points on a circle. \(EF\) is a tangent to the circle at \(A\). \(AB\) is parallel to \(DC\).
Find the lowest common multiple (LCM) of \(15xy^{3}\) and \(18x^{4}y\).
Write \(0.328\) as a fraction in its simplest form.
Solid \(A\) is mathematically similar to solid \(B\).
The height of solid \(A\) is 7 cm and its surface area is \(60 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\). The surface area of solid \(B\) is \(540 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\).
Make \(t\) the subject of the formula.
The diagram shows a sector of a circle, centre \(O\).
The radius of the circle is 6 cm.
Calculate the length of the major arc \(A B\).
Give your answer in its simplest form in terms of \(\pi\).
The diagram shows two different right-angled triangles joined by a common side.
Find the \(y\)-coordinate of the midpoint of \(A B\).
Find an expression for \(a\) in terms of \(b\).
\(A\) is the point \((a,12)\) and \(B\) is the point \((b,27)\).
\(D\) is the point \((22,34)\) and \(E\) is the point \((23,39)\).
\(D\) is the point on \(C E\) such that \(2 C E=5 D E\).
